concept.title: Administering
concept.shortdesc: Administration tasks can be completed by system administrators or messaging administrators by using the , or by using the .

conbody.note: If you are administering a pair of appliances that are configured for high availability, do not make administrative or configuration changes during the synchronization period that occurs after a member of an HA pair is restarted. You can view the progress of the synchronization by using the imaserver status command. The SyncProgress value indicates the percentage complete.

conbody.section:
Administering by using the
has a REST (REpresentational State Transfer) interface and provides which you can use to administer and monitor your system.
To run a , you call a method on a REST resource and pass parameters or a request in JSON format. The methods that the use are POST, GET, and DELETE:
The POST method creates or updates a reosurce.
The GET method retrieves data about a resource.
The DELETE method deletes a resource. You can write scripts or use the Linux program curl to run the . Combine a REST URI with the REST method to be used and the data to be passed to create the REST request.
